"Couch Cat" is the name & relaxing is my game! When I'm not soaking up the sun or enjoying a snack, you'll find me cuddled up on the couch. I'll be happiest just relaxing with you & getting some love in between nap sessions!

The saying goes "those who have a cat have no need for sculpture." I'm a confident cat who wants to be the ruler of your kingdom. I love to be loved, but on my terms. As a "Holier Than Meow", my favorite past time is simply being visually admired.

If you don‰Ûªt mind a little drool slung here & there I might be the gal for you! I‰Ûªd do best with adopters that will make sure I‰Ûªm given toys & food separate from K9 pals my same size & give me a consistent daily routine! Please contact the Foster Department to learn more about me and schedule a meet and greet 801-261-2919 x215.

From the shadows of the night a "Mystery Meow" will emerge to steal your heart! Most of us came here with no history, but some of us are just timid & our personalities have yet to shine. Give me a chance & I'll show you just how amazing I can be!
null

Never fear! "Frisky Feline" is here! Leaping from the highest heights, pouncing from rooftops & saving my humans from the evil red dot! Being a hero is hard work, but someone has to do it! I need plenty of play time to be the best friend I can be!

A handsome hunk on the lookout for my perfect match! I was originally a transfer here at HSU; my previous home described me as hyper, affectionate, & friendly! I have been through a lot of changes lately so my forever home will need to have some patience & help guide me to ensure my success!

I am a transfer from another shelter & am ready to start my new life! Although my history is a mystery, I like the people & other dogs I have met here at HSU. It is unknown if I have been around cats or children before. I may or may not be fully house trained‰Û_some of us transfer animals have lived our entire lives in a loving home environment, while others have never lived indoors or been part of a family. I can tell you that we are all very eager to learn!I may need some guidance & a healthy dose of patience while I'm learning the ropes. A regular daily routine, positive reinforcement, crate training & exercise will help me learn to be the very best canine companion I can be! If you do decide to take me home, the behavior staff at HSU is here to help me succeed, so feel free to contact them if you need help!If you think we're a match, please bring your family (including other dogs) to The Humane Society of Utah to meet me today!My temporary home is:THE HUMANE SOCIETY OF UTAH4242 SOUTH 300 WEST MURRAY, UTAH 84107 (801) 261-2919 x227WWW.UTAHHUMANE.ORG

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I have loads of love to give & am very loyal to those I‰Ûªm bonded to.- I‰Ûªm extremely intelligent & very motivated to learn, especially when there are treats involved!- I‰Ûªm very athletic! I love to run & enjoy playing fetch.What I‰Ûªm working on:- Reactivity in kennel environment: Take me out for a walk & see what a different dog I become! - Resource guarding: I tend to be a bit greedy when it comes to my food, bones & toys.- Social skills with new dogs: I‰Ûªm insecure when meeting new canines & prefer dogs who respect my space.What I‰Ûªm looking for:- A very active household with herding dog experienced owners & no kids under 13 years of age. - A secure yard, with supervision outside.- Canine companions who are similar to my own size & will respect my personal space.- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise.- Ongoing positive reinforcement training to help with resource guardingThink this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU‰Ûªs Behavior Department.*

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I have loads of love to give & I‰Ûªm very loyal to those I‰Ûªm bonded to.- I already know cues to sit, lay down & stay.- I'm super intelligent & athletic, once I‰Ûªve had a chance to come out of my shell.What I‰Ûªm working on:- Social skills with new people: I‰Ûªm shy at first when it comes to meeting new people so I‰Ûªll need proper, slow introductions when meeting strangers.- Body Handling Sensitivity: I enjoy physical attention on my own terms. I prefer gentle, soft petting but I‰Ûªm not a fan of being hugged or restrained, especially not by strangers.What I‰Ûªm looking for:- A low traffic home with no kids under 13 years of age. - Active adopters who have herding breed experience.- Well socialized canine companions who can help me come out of my shell & build up my confidence.- Understanding adopters who know it will take time & patience to help me overcome my fear of new people.- Ongoing positive reinforcement training for socialization. Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU‰Ûªs Behavior Department.* (If they are not available, you will need to make an appointment.)

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I have loads of love to give & I‰Ûªm very loyal to those I‰Ûªm bonded to.- I already know cues for sit & stay.- I'm super silly & energetic once I‰Ûªve had a chance to come out of my shell.What I‰Ûªm working on:- Body Handling Sensitivity: I enjoy physical attention on my own terms. I prefer gentle, soft petting but I‰Ûªm not a fan of being hugged or restrained, especially not by strangers.- Social skills with new people: I‰Ûªm shy at first when it comes to new people so I‰Ûªll need proper, slow introductions when meeting strangers.- Social skills with new dogs: I‰Ûªm insecure when meeting new canines & prefer dogs who respect my space.What I‰Ûªm looking for:- A low traffic home with experienced dog owners & no kids under 13 years of age. - Well socialized canine companions similar in size to help me come out of my shell & build confidence.- Understanding adopters who know it will take time & patience to help me overcome my fear of new people.- Ample mental stimulation & exercise are going to be a daily necessity for me once I come out of my shell.- Ongoing positive reinforcement training for socialization & handling sensitivity. Not to toot my own horn, but I'm a "Fancy Foster"! I needed some extra TLC when I arrived, so I went to foster care. The foster department knows the most about me & would love to tell you everything. Please ask the staff to "fetch" them for you!

Need a shoulder to cry on? Look no further I‰Ûªm a wise & genuine gal tried & true! A cuddler & a kisser, I‰Ûªm the girl for you! I‰Ûªd love nothing more than a home that will let me come inside & be part of the family, so I can relax for the rest of my days! Ask staff about crate training tips.

IF MY FACE DOESN'T MAKE YOUR HEART MELT I DON'T KNOW WHAT WILL! I'M ON THE SEARCH FOR ADOPTERS THAT CAN TEACH ME THE ROPES TO BEING A GREAT K9 COMPANION! I'M GOING TO REQUIRE TONS OF EXERCISE, MENTAL STIMULATION & OF COURSE SOME PATIENCE TOO!

Cassie is a sweet shy girl who would love to find a home that is quiet and calm. She is a transfer from another shelter so most of her history is a mystery, but we've learned a little about her while she's been in foster care. She gets along with other dogs her size. Cassie has been quite shy of people, but once she warms up this lil girl does enjoy being pet and held in a way that makes her feel safe. She would do best in a home without young children, ages 13 and older would be okay.If you'd like to meet Cassie and make her a part of your family please call the Foster Department to schedule a Meet and Greet appointment 801-261-2919 x215.

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I already know cues to sit, lay down & shake!- I‰Ûªm already crate trained!- I‰Ûªm extremely intelligent & very athletic! I love to run & enjoy playing fetch.What I‰Ûªm working on:- Impulse control: I have a lot of energy & can get a bit carried away when I‰Ûªm frustrated.- Resource guarding: I tend to be a bit greedy when it comes to my food, bones & toys.What I‰Ûªm looking for:- A very active household with herding dog experienced owners & no kids under 13 years of age. - A secure yard, with supervision outside. (I‰Ûªve been known to be a bit of a Houdini!)- Canine companions who are similar to my own size & energy level.- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise.- Ongoing positive reinforcement training to help with impulse control & resource guarding.Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU‰Ûªs Behavior Department.*

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I‰Ûªm extremely intelligent & very motivated to learn, especially when there are treats involved!- I‰Ûªm a perfect gentleman on a leash, as long as I‰Ûªm walked using a no-pull harness.- I already know cues to sit, down, wait & shake. (I‰Ûªll do anything for a treat & I love to learn!)What I‰Ûªm working on:- Impulse control: I have a lot of energy & when I‰Ûªm excited I sometimes forget how strong I am. - Basic manners: I still need training to learn some of the basics, like potty training & house manners.What I‰Ûªm looking for:- A very active household with hound dog experienced owners & no kids under age 13. - Canine companions similar in size & energy level.- Forgiving neighbors! (I‰Ûªm a hound who loves the sound of my own voice.)- Ample mental stimulation & lots of exercise are going to be a daily necessity for me.- Ongoing positive reinforcement training for impulse control & basic manners.Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU‰Ûªs Behavior Department.*

Not to toot my own horn, but I'm a "Fancy Foster"! I needed some extra TLC when I arrived, so I went to foster care. The foster department knows the most about me & would love to tell you everything. Please ask the staff to "fetch" them for you!

I like to talk. I am a very clever climber. I adore baby talk. I am very sweet and enjoy being pet, but I am also shy at first with new people. I also have some cloudiness in my eyes. if you have further questions about me or my health please contact the Humane Society of Utah Adoptions Department 801-261-2919 ext 227

I am a transfer from another shelter & am ready to start my new life! Although my history is a mystery, I like the people & other dogs I have met here at HSU. It is unknown if I have been around cats or children before. I may or may not be fully house trained‰Û_some of us transfer animals have lived our entire lives in a loving home environment, while others have never lived indoors or been part of a family. I can tell you that we are all very eager to learn!I may need some guidance & a healthy dose of patience while I'm learning the ropes. A regular daily routine, positive reinforcement, crate training & exercise will help me learn to be the very best canine companion I can be! If you do decide to take me home, the behavior staff at HSU is here to help me succeed, so feel free to contact them if you need help!If you think we're a match, please bring your family (including other dogs) to The Humane Society of Utah to meet me today!My temporary home is:THE HUMANE SOCIETY OF UTAH4242 SOUTH 300 WEST MURRAY, UTAH 84107 (801) 261-2919 x227WWW.UTAHHUMANE.ORG

Looking for an energetic partner to explore the world with? Not only do I have mounds of energy, but I‰Ûªm also pretty cute too! I‰Ûªll need adopters who can give me a daily routine, mental stimulation, & have knowledge of my breed! If you can provide all of this & more consider meeting me today!

The Pets in Progress program is HSU's initiative to successfully place animals who are currently working on some behavioral challenges. Best with experienced pet owners, they require a bit of extra training as they work towards becoming the best companions they can be. At HSU, we know they are well worth the effort!What I have to offer:- I‰Ûªm playful & affectionate with people once I‰Ûªve had a chance to warm up!- I‰Ûªm extremely intelligent & eager to learn!- I‰Ûªm well-mannered & walk great on a leash!What I‰Ûªm working on:- Social skills with other dogs: I‰Ûªm uncomfortable around other canines & prefer brief encounters with mellow dogs who respect my space.- Basic manners: I have some training under my belt already, but there is always room for improvement!What I‰Ûªm looking for:- An active household with experienced dog owners & no children under the age of 8. - A home where I can be the star of the show & won‰Ûªt have to share the spotlight with another dog. - A home with no cats or other small animals. (I‰Ûªm a little too interested in them, if you know what I mean.)- A new stylist! (I will require regular professional grooming to keep me comfortable & healthy.)- Ample mental stimulation, daily exercise & ongoing positive reinforcement training.Think this might be the right pet for you? Talk to a staff member today!*Please note that Pets in Progress adoptions are approved by HSU‰Ûªs Behavior Department.* (If they are not available, you will need to make an appointment.)
